001package io.cyborgcode.roa.ui.selenium.smart;
002
003import io.cyborgcode.roa.ui.annotations.HandleUiException;
004import io.cyborgcode.roa.ui.log.LogUi;
005import io.cyborgcode.roa.ui.selenium.decorators.WebDriverDecorator;
006import io.cyborgcode.roa.ui.selenium.handling.ExceptionHandlingWebDriver;
007import io.cyborgcode.roa.ui.selenium.locating.SmartFinder;
008import java.time.Duration;
009import java.util.Arrays;
010import java.util.List;
011import java.util.Objects;
012import java.util.Optional;
013import java.util.function.Consumer;
014import java.util.function.Function;
015import lombok.Getter;
016import lombok.NonNull;
017import lombok.Setter;
018import lombok.SneakyThrows;
019import org.openqa.selenium.By;
020import org.openqa.selenium.WebDriver;
021import org.openqa.selenium.WebElement;
022import org.openqa.selenium.support.ui.ExpectedConditions;
023import org.openqa.selenium.support.ui.WebDriverWait;
024
025import static io.cyborgcode.roa.ui.config.UiConfigHolder.getUiConfig;
026
027/**
028 * A custom wrapper for {@link WebDriver} that enhances element handling,
029 * adds exception management, and provides built-in support for Shadow DOM elements.
030 *
031 * <p>It integrates with Selenium functions while allowing configuration-based
032 * handling of standard and shadow root elements.
033 *
034 * @author Cyborg Code Syndicate üíçüë®üíª
035 */
036@Getter
037public class SmartWebDriver extends WebDriverDecorator {
038
039   private final WebDriverWait wait;
040   @Setter
041   private boolean keepDriverForSession;
042
043
044   private static final String SECONDS = " seconds";
045
046
047   /**
048    * Constructs a {@code SmartWebDriver} wrapping the given {@link WebDriver}.
049    *
050    * @param original The original Selenium WebDriver instance to wrap.
051    */
052   public SmartWebDriver(WebDriver original) {
053      super(original);
054      this.wait = new WebDriverWait(original, Duration.ofSeconds(getUiConfig().waitDuration()));
055   }
056
057   /**
058    * Finds a single element using {@link By} and returns a wrapped {@link SmartWebElement}.
059    *
060    * @param by The {@link By} locator to find the element.
061    * @return A {@link SmartWebElement} instance.
062    */
063   @HandleUiException
064   public SmartWebElement findSmartElement(By by) {
065      return findSmartElementInternal(by, null);
066   }
067
068   /**
069    * Finds a single element with a specified wait time.
070    *
071    * @param by           The {@link By} locator.
072    * @param waitInMillis The wait time in milliseconds.
073    * @return A {@link SmartWebElement} instance.
074    */
075   public SmartWebElement findSmartElement(By by, long waitInMillis) {
076      return findSmartElementInternal(by, waitInMillis);
077   }
078
079   /**
080    * Finds multiple elements matching the given {@link By} locator.
081    *
082    * @param by The {@link By} locator to find elements.
083    * @return A list of {@link SmartWebElement}.
084    */
085   @HandleUiException
086   public List<SmartWebElement> findSmartElements(By by) {
087      if (!getUiConfig().useWrappedSeleniumFunctions()) {
088         return SmartFinder.findElementsNoWrap(getOriginal(), by);
089      }
090
091      Consumer<Function<WebDriver, ?>> waitFn = this::waitWithoutFailure;
092      try {
093         if (getUiConfig().useShadowRoot()) {
094            return SmartFinder.findElementsWithShadowRootDriver(this, by, waitFn);
095         } else {
096            return SmartFinder.findElementsNormally(getOriginal(), by, waitFn);
097         }
098      } catch (Exception e) {
099         return handleException("findElements", e, new Object[] {by});
100      }
101   }
102
103   /**
104    * Overrides Selenium's {@link WebDriver#findElement(By)} to support both normal and Shadow DOM elements.
105    *
106    * @param by The {@link By} locator to find an element.
107    * @return The found {@link WebElement}.
108    */
109   @Override
110   @NonNull
111   public WebElement findElement(@NonNull By by) {
112      Consumer<Function<WebDriver, ?>> waitFn =
113            condition -> {
114               try {
115                  WebDriverWait customWait = new WebDriverWait(getOriginal(), Duration.ofMillis(10));
116                  customWait.until(condition);
117               } catch (Exception ignored) {
118                  //ignore failure from wait
119               }
120            };
121      if (getUiConfig().useShadowRoot()) {
122         return SmartFinder.findElementWithShadowRootDriver(this, by, waitFn, 10L);
123      } else {
124         return SmartFinder.findElementNormally(getOriginal(), by, waitFn);
125      }
126   }
127
128   /**
129    * Overrides Selenium's {@link WebDriver#findElements(By)} to support both normal and Shadow DOM elements.
130    *
131    * @param by The {@link By} locator to find elements.
132    * @return A list of found {@link WebElement}.
133    */
134   @Override
135   @NonNull
136   public List<WebElement> findElements(@NonNull By by) {
137      Consumer<Function<WebDriver, ?>> waitFn =
138            condition -> {
139               try {
140                  WebDriverWait customWait = new WebDriverWait(getOriginal(), Duration.ofMillis(10));
141                  customWait.until(condition);
142               } catch (Exception ignored) {
143                  //ignore failure from wait
144               }
145            };
146      if (getUiConfig().useShadowRoot()) {
147         List<SmartWebElement> elementsWithShadowRootDriver =
148               SmartFinder.findElementsWithShadowRootDriver(this, by, waitFn);
149         return elementsWithShadowRootDriver.stream()
150               .map(WebElement.class::cast)
151               .toList();
152      } else {
153         List<SmartWebElement> elementsNormally = SmartFinder.findElementsNormally(getOriginal(), by, waitFn);
154         return elementsNormally.stream()
155               .map(WebElement.class::cast)
156               .toList();
157      }
158   }
159
160   /**
161    * Finds a single {@link SmartWebElement} with optional wait time, supporting both standard and Shadow DOM searches.
162    *
163    * @param by           The {@link By} locator used to find the element.
164    * @param waitInMillis The optional wait duration in milliseconds. If null, a default wait function is used.
165    * @return The found {@link SmartWebElement}, or handles the exception if the element is not found.
166    */
167   private SmartWebElement findSmartElementInternal(By by, Long waitInMillis) {
168      if (!getUiConfig().useWrappedSeleniumFunctions()) {
169         return SmartFinder.findElementNoWrap(getOriginal(), by);
170      }
171
172      Consumer<Function<WebDriver, ?>> waitFn = (waitInMillis == null)
173            ? this::waitWithoutFailure
174            : condition -> {
175               try {
176                  WebDriverWait customWait = new WebDriverWait(getOriginal(), Duration.ofMillis(waitInMillis));
177                  customWait.until(condition);
178               } catch (Exception ignored) {
179                  //ignore failure from wait
180               }
181            };
182
183      try {
184         if (getUiConfig().useShadowRoot()) {
185            return SmartFinder.findElementWithShadowRootDriver(this, by, waitFn, waitInMillis);
186         } else {
187            return SmartFinder.findElementNormally(getOriginal(), by, waitFn);
188         }
189      } catch (Exception e) {
190         return handleException("findElement", e, new Object[] {by});
191      }
192   }
193
194   /**
195    * Checks if an action can be performed without throwing an exception.
196    *
197    * @param runnable The action to execute.
198    * @return {@code true} if no exception occurs, {@code false} otherwise.
199    */
200   public boolean checkNoException(Runnable runnable) {
201      try {
202         runnable.run();
203         return true;
204      } catch (Exception e) {
205         return false;
206      }
207   }
208
209   /**
210    * Waits until a specific {@link SmartWebElement} becomes visible.
211    *
212    * @param element The element to wait for.
213    * @param seconds Maximum wait time in seconds.
214    */
215   public void waitUntilElementIsShown(SmartWebElement element, int seconds) {
216      WebDriverWait customWait = new WebDriverWait(this, Duration.ofSeconds(seconds));
217      try {
218         customWait.until(ExpectedConditions.visibilityOf(element));
219      } catch (Exception e) {
220         LogUi.error("Element wasn't displayed after: " + seconds + SECONDS);
221      }
222   }
223
224   /**
225    * Waits until an element located by {@link By} becomes visible.
226    *
227    * @param by      The locator.
228    * @param seconds Maximum wait time in seconds.
229    */
230   public void waitUntilElementIsShown(By by, int seconds) {
231      WebDriverWait customWait = new WebDriverWait(this, Duration.ofSeconds(seconds));
232      try {
233         customWait.until(ExpectedConditions.presenceOfElementLocated(by));
234      } catch (Exception e) {
235         LogUi.error("Element wasn't displayed after: " + seconds + SECONDS);
236      }
237   }
238
239   /**
240    * Waits until a specific {@link SmartWebElement} is no longer visible.
241    *
242    * @param element The element to wait for.
243    * @param seconds Maximum wait time in seconds.
244    */
245   public void waitUntilElementIsRemoved(SmartWebElement element, int seconds) {
246      WebDriverWait customWait = new WebDriverWait(this, Duration.ofSeconds(seconds));
247      try {
248         customWait.until(ExpectedConditions.invisibilityOf(element));
249      } catch (Exception e) {
250         LogUi.error("Element wasn't removed after: " + seconds + SECONDS);
251      }
252   }
253
254   /**
255    * Waits until an element located by {@link By} is no longer visible.
256    *
257    * @param by      The locator.
258    * @param seconds Maximum wait time in seconds.
259    */
260   public void waitUntilElementIsRemoved(By by, int seconds) {
261      WebDriverWait customWait = new WebDriverWait(this, Duration.ofSeconds(seconds));
262      try {
263         customWait.until(ExpectedConditions.invisibilityOfElementLocated(by));
264      } catch (Exception e) {
265         LogUi.error("Element wasn't removed after: " + seconds + SECONDS);
266      }
267   }
268
269
270   private <T> void waitWithoutFailure(Function<WebDriver, T> condition) {
271      try {
272         wait.until(condition);
273      } catch (Exception ignored) {
274         //ignore failure from wait
275      }
276   }
277
278   @SneakyThrows
279   @SuppressWarnings("unchecked")
280   private <T> T handleException(String methodName, Exception exception, Object[] params) {
281      Throwable cause = exception.getCause() != null ? exception.getCause() : exception;
282
283      Optional<ExceptionHandlingWebDriver> exceptionHandlingOptional =
284            Arrays.stream(ExceptionHandlingWebDriver.values())
285                  .filter(enumVal ->
286                        enumVal.getMethodName().equals(methodName)
287                              && Objects.nonNull(enumVal.getExceptionHandlingMap().get(cause.getClass()))
288                  )
289                  .findFirst();
290
291      if (exceptionHandlingOptional.isPresent()) {
292         try {
293            return (T) exceptionHandlingOptional.get()
294                  .getExceptionHandlingMap()
295                  .get(cause.getClass())
296                  .apply(this.getOriginal(), params);
297         } catch (Exception handlerException) {
298            LogUi.error("Framework attempted to handle an exception in method '" + methodName
299                  + "', but the handler failed with: " + handlerException.getClass().getSimpleName() + ": "
300                  + handlerException.getMessage(), handlerException);
301            exception.addSuppressed(handlerException);
302            LogUi.error("Propagating original exception: " + exception.getClass().getSimpleName()
303                  + ": " + exception.getMessage(), exception);
304            throw exception;
305         }
306      } else {
307         String locator = (params.length > 0 && params[0] instanceof By) ? params[0].toString() : "Unknown locator";
308         String exceptionMessage = exception.getClass().getSimpleName();
309
310         String errorMessage = String.format(
311               "Exception handling failed for method '%s'. Exception: '%s'. Parameters: Locator - '%s'.",
312               methodName, exceptionMessage, locator
313         );
314         LogUi.error(errorMessage);
315         throw exception;
316      }
317   }
318}
